vignette.name: HISSTools Impulse Response Toolbox
vignette.p:
Overview
HIRT (HISSTools Impulse Response Toolbox) is a set of tools for working with convolution and IRs (Impulse Responses) in Max. This set of objects addresses tasks such as measuring IRs, spectral display from realtime input/buffers, and non-realtime convolution, deconvolution and inversion, as well as realtime zero or low latency convolution. The objects are open source and BSD licensed:
https://github.com/HISSTools/HISSTools_Impulse_Response_Toolbox
These tools enable the design of solutions to a number of specific issues, such as Loudspeaker and Room Correction, Close Acoustic Capture Correction (Microphone Correction), and Creative Applications of Convolution. The toolbox can be downloaded from the Max Package Manager.
HIRT is by Alex Harker & Pierre Alexandre Tremblay, CeReNeM at the University of Huddersfield, UK.
http://www.thehiss.org
Concept
The first goal of the HIRT project is to allow for loudspeaker / room corrections to be generated and applied rapidly and efficiently for use in a concert environment. By extension, such corrections can also be employed in a studio setting.
The second motivation for the HIRT is to improve the frequency balance of close microphone or pick-up capture. The idea is to take a close capture of an instrument that is relatively free from issues of spill and feedback, and improve the frequency balance prior to electronic processing, thus achieving better tonal balance.
However, it was felt that creating these specific solutions would be both inflexible for the given tasks, and also limited in terms of re-application. Therefore a highly modular design has been implemented, suited to a large number of convolution and impulse response related problems. The HIRT is thus suitable for use in relation to several general problems, including multichannel IR measurement, multichannel convolution, FIR Design, crosstalk cancellation and convolution reverb.
The underlying technical approaches include:
FFT-based Processing
Fast Deconvolution with Regularisation
IR Measurement
Frequency Smoothing
Phase Alteration
The Max Package includes:
21 externals with full help file and reference documentation
Various examples of use
3 hirt.* abstractions for Reverb, Convolution and Impulse Response Authoring tasks
For technical details see the References linked to from the Extras overview file
